title.rendered: What is Post Production And Post Processing in Photography?

content.rendered:
Table Of Contents

  • 1 What Does Post Production Mean?
    • 1.1 What is Post Processing?
    • 1.2 Photography Post Processing Workflow
    • 1.3 What Is Production And Post Production?
    • 1.4 Why Is Post Processing Important?
    • 1.5 What Is The Best Post-Processing Photo Software?
    • 1.6 Bordie Capron

After completing a successful shooting, a photographer starts preparing for publishing his/her masterpiece on the web. 

But to make a simple and ordinary image into a masterpiece, the process between photographing and publishing has a major role to play.

And this process is what we know is post processing or post production in photography. Post production is not only editing the images. 

It’s a group of work that is required after the shooting till sharing the images with the audience.

In this editorial, I will try to answer what is post production and post processing in photography and I hope you guys will get a clear idea about it.

What Does Post Production Mean?

A lot of photography professionals might have second thoughts about my opinion on the post production but according to me, post means after and production means the process that goes into creating something.

So post production should be all the things that are done after the actual shooting till producing the final product. Post production covers

  • Transferring all the materials to the computer and back up them
  • Sort the photos you capture and find the perfect one.
  • Editing them using image editing software
  • Fix grainy photos, spots and blemishes as well.
  • Prepare the materials for printing, sharing, and posting them

What is Post Processing?

Post processing is a part of post production that refers to all the image editing processes a photographer does after completing the shooting. 

We often think that post production and post processing is the same thing but its not true.

Photography post processing workflow for image covers different types of editing using photo editing software. 

You have to be an expert in image editing services if you want to post-process your images flawlessly to publish them. 

Images that come directly from the camera can have many issues like dust. grain, spots, framing problem, exposure problem, white balance problem etc. Without fixing these issues you won’t be able to create the masterpiece you want to create.

Let’s know a couple of photography dependents that require professional photo post processing

1. Overexposure Issue

In the HDR method, photographers capture overexposed and also underexposed photos intentionally. 

But photographers who started their career recently sometimes click the overexposed photo and realize it later in the post production. 

In that case, they must go for image post processing to fix it in the post production photography.

So if you ever miss your perfect exposure while shooting, don’t lose your confidence because photography post processing can save your day of hard work.

you can also check our fix overexposed photo guide if you are searching for free methods of  fixing an overexposed photo

2. White Balance Issue

Indoor photos are the major victim of the white balance issue. Images get too much yellowish or blueish effect because of incorrect white balance. 

We may not realize the issue at first but after transferring the image to the big screen it gets more visible. With photo post processing, you can fix the white balance of your photo very easily.

3. Shoot in RAW Mode

Most of the camera has default settings to capture images in jpeg format. But the problem with jpeg format is it does minimal editing to the image and make it look moderate but locks down the settings. 

So you can’t edit jpeg format and if you do you will lose the image quality.

On the other hand, RAW formate clicks the image with every detail the camera can capture and keeps it intact for post-processing. 

If you want your post processing photography look flawless and perfect then my recommendation will be to shoot in RAW mode and capture every detail you can.

4. HDR Shooting

Shooting in the HDR method is used when photographers want to capture every detail of the high dynamic range from the background of a photo. Photographers capture photos with different exposures from too bright to too dark. 

In the post-processing, photo editing experts merge all the images and get the HDR image then they do image retouching to fix the issues.

Photography Post Processing Workflow

In photo post-processing, the working process photoshop experts follow to turn an ordinary image into an amazing one is what we know as photography post processing workflow. 

Post processing workflow has 6 essential steps that every photoshop experts must-do while editing images in photoshop. The steps are given below,

  1. Crop and resize the image
  2. Check and Fix The White Balance
  3. Fix The Exposure
  4. Fix Hue and saturation
  5. Fix Grainy and Noise From Photos
  6. Check the Sharpness

Editing photos and making them jaw-dropping isn’t any rocket science thing. With basic knowledge of photoshop and following the post-processing workflow, you can make any photo of yours look flawless.

What Is Production And Post Production?

In photography, production is the actual shooting and what we do in the shooting period and post production is the processes of what we do after the production period such as completing the shooting.

Why Is Post Processing Important?

Post processing allows photographers to work on the image after completing the shoot and fix any issues if occur afterwards. It creates high chances and provides the ability to the photographers to make their images a masterpiece. 

Images that come out directly from the camera may have multiple issues such as incorrect white balance, overexposed image and many more. 

Because of the post processing photography, we can fix all the issue and produce amazing photos.

What Is The Best Post-Processing Photo Software?

There is a lot of photo post processing software in the market for better image editing but not all of them provides what they promise. Some of the best image editing software that can run a smooth photography post processing workflow is Adobe Photoshop CC 2021, DxO Photolab, Corel Paintshop Pro, and Cyberlink PhotoDirector.

Among these, the most used professional image editing software is Adobe Photoshop CC for the perfect post production photography.

Bottom Line

Post production photography or post processing, no matter which definition you believe, you can’t pick one and leave behind the other. 

In this editorial, I tried to describe what is post production and post processing in photography with my simple words. If you have read the article and have different thoughts you can share down below.

But we all will agree on one thing that photo post production and post processing both are important to produce great photos.

Bordie Capron

Author

“Bordie Capron is a Sr. Content Maker who is working in The Clipping Path Service an US-based image and video post-production company for over 7+ years. She completed her degree in graphic designing and worked as a graphic designing expert for several years. She always loved writing”
